docs.snippet: It is hard to find much healing in Ferguson, Missouri....

headline.main: Ferguson Wants Peace Instead of Protests, but Anger Still Simmers
headline.print_headline: Ferguson Wants Peace Instead of Protests, but Anger Still Simmers

docs.lead_paragraph: It is hard to find much healing in Ferguson, Missouri.

docs.snippet: Caesars Entertainment Operating Company, which owns or manages 44 casinos and resorts in the United States, will also split itself into several new companies....

headline.main: Caesars Unit Takes a Step Toward Chapter 11

docs.abstract: Caesars Entertainment Operating Company, which owns or manages 44 casinos and resorts in the United States, will also split itself into several new companies.

docs.snippet: North Korea on Friday denied the FBI's accusation that it was behind a devastating hacking attack on Sony but it said the now-shelved film "The Interview" mocked the impoverished but nuclear-armed country....

headline.main: North Korea Denies Connection With Sony Hacking
headline.print_headline: North Korea Denies Connection With Sony Hacking

docs.lead_paragraph: North Korea on Friday denied the FBI's accusation that it was behind a devastating hacking attack on Sony but it said the now-shelved film "The Interview" mocked the impoverished but nuclear-armed country.

docs.snippet: President Barack Obama banned new investments in Crimea on Friday, slapping sanctions on the peninsula that Russia annexed from Ukraine earlier this year....

headline.main: Obama Imposes Sanctions on Crimea, Echoes EU
headline.print_headline: Obama Imposes Sanctions on Crimea, Echoes EU

docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama banned new investments in Crimea on Friday, slapping sanctions on the peninsula that Russia annexed from Ukraine earlier this year.

docs.snippet: Cuba will defend its socialist principles and will not return to capitalism just because it has agreed a detente with the United States, the daughter of President Raul Castro said, dispelling any notion that U.S. companies would be free to roll in...

headline.main: Cuba Not Returning to Capitalism Despite U.S. Deal: Castro's Daughter
headline.print_headline: Cuba Not Returning to Capitalism Despite U.S. Deal: Castro's Daughter

docs.lead_paragraph: Cuba will defend its socialist principles and will not return to capitalism just because it has agreed a detente with the United States, the daughter of President Raul Castro said, dispelling any notion that U.S. companies would be free to roll into Cuba.

docs.snippet: Comments from Federal Reserve chair Janet Yellen spurred a Santa Claus rally this week, analysts see the rally spilling over into 2015. Leah Duncan reports....

headline.main: Christmas may have come early this year for the markets
headline.sub: Christmas may have come early this year for the markets

docs.lead_paragraph: Comments from Federal Reserve chair Janet Yellen spurred a Santa Claus rally this week, analysts see the rally spilling over into 2015. Leah Duncan reports.

docs.snippet: The retailer said nearly 1.2 million customer payment cards may have been exposed during a security breach earlier this year....

headline.main: Staples: Customer Data Exposed in Security Breach
headline.print_headline: Staples: Customer Data Exposed in Security Breach

docs.lead_paragraph: The retailer said nearly 1.2 million customer payment cards may have been exposed during a security breach earlier this year.

docs.snippet: A man charged with having once possessed the gun that prosecutors believe the Boston Marathon bombing suspects used to kill an MIT police officer pleaded guilty Friday to gun possession and drug charges....

headline.main: Man Pleads Guilty in Gun Case Linked to Marathon
headline.print_headline: Man Pleads Guilty in Gun Case Linked to Marathon

docs.lead_paragraph: A man charged with having once possessed the gun that prosecutors believe the Boston Marathon bombing suspects used to kill an MIT police officer pleaded guilty Friday to gun possession and drug charges.

docs.snippet: The United States on Friday prohibited investment in Crimea and slapped sanctions on 24 Ukrainians and Russians and several companies it determined were contributing to destabilizing Ukraine....

headline.main: U.S. Prohibits Investment in Crimea Among Slew of Sanctions
headline.print_headline: U.S. Prohibits Investment in Crimea Among Slew of Sanctions

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States on Friday prohibited investment in Crimea and slapped sanctions on 24 Ukrainians and Russians and several companies it determined were contributing to destabilizing Ukraine.

docs.snippet: A former director of technology for Sony Pictures Entertainment has sued the company over the data breach that resulted in the online posting of his private financial and personal information....

headline.main: Sony Faces 4th Ex-Employee Lawsuit Over Hack
headline.print_headline: Sony Faces 4th Ex-Employee Lawsuit Over Hack

docs.lead_paragraph: A former director of technology for Sony Pictures Entertainment has sued the company over the data breach that resulted in the online posting of his private financial and personal information.
